Let‚Äôs Talk About‚Ä¶ Baby Care!

For our 11th #GreenBookFairies post in support of #PlasticFreeJuly, we are talking about how to reduce your disposables when it comes to babies!

The problem:

A baby will use 4,000 disposable diapers before being clean, this represents in France alone 1 million tonnes of waste per year (ADEME.fr). Organic disposable diapers are biodegradable, but only between 50 and 70%.

The plastics and PVCs from which many toys for babies and children are made have a very significant impact on the environment. They are highly breakable (and often unable to be repaired), they take thousands of years to break down and in that time will leech toxins into the earth or damage sealife.

The solutions:

üß∏ Use washable diapers/nappies: this is the most eco-friendly option, with a baby needing about twenty of these.
üß∏ Consider making your own detergent for all the washing you do for the baby to wash them (we posted a recipe recently on our blog!) and dry laundry and diapers in the open air
üß∏ Buy toys made with natural products such as wood (look for labels PEFC or FSC), bamboo, wool, cotton or metal. 
üß∏ Buy toys from companies like Greentoys that use recycled plastic from discarded toys
üß∏ Use eco-friendly glue and vegetable ink, along with biodegradable glitter for play time
üß∏ Support charities by getting your baby clothes and toys secondhand

Top tip! More fun: make your own toys! Balls, cubes, play mats, fabric books ... you can find lots of ideas on YouTube.

Accounts to follow:

Check out @globalorganictextilestandard and @oleoandcompany for responsible and handmade baby care items!

Fairy verdict:

‚ÄúWhen we learned that my wife was pregnant, we decided to make as many things as possible for our future baby (clothes, blanket, toys, play mat ...). In addition to avoiding plastic (especially for toys), it was a way for us to celebrate the coming of the baby by putting all our love in the manufacture of each object.‚Äù

Joris, France. Father of Victor, 2 üë∂

There are about 1,000 different kinds of bamboo and many grow quite fast, but only a few species can reach Guinness World Record speeds. The current record is an astonishing rate of 35 inches in a day, which is nearly three feet. The more typical growth rate in temperate climates is more like 1 to 4 inches per day, which is still a lot.

Recycling can be super confusing. What can we recycle, how can we recycle it, and where do we get this information from? Unfortunately, this is different not only in every country, but even between many local districts.‚Å†
‚Å†
In Australia, local councils are primarily responsible for the recycling done through roadside bin collections, and therefore we need to refer to them to see what we can recycle through these methods. In many places, there will be similar protocols in place. If you can't find the answers you need through some Google searches, don't be afraid to get in contact with your councils, waste collection and government bodies.‚Å†
‚Å†
After you've gotten hold of this information, all there's left to do is start recycling! As we previously discussed, recycling is a last resort to refusing, reducing and reusing. But once we're here, there's still a bit to think about. Most products will have codes on them to indicate what sort of material it is, or even a description of what parts can be recycled. In general, items with codes 1, 2, and 5 can be recycled at most facilities. Once you're familiar with the items that you can recycle, and how your local area deals with it, you can start making it easier for yourself! Set up different bins at home for different types of recyclables; paper and cardboard, hard plastics, glass etc. It will make it much easier to deal with, and is a great way to get others in your house on board!‚Å†
‚Å†
Try your best, get involved, and get those around you involved like your family and friends! We have nothing to lose, and everything to gain by recycling, reducing our waste, and closing the circle.‚Å†
‚Å†
Written by Nicole Fickling (@moonshoesnicole)‚Å†

It doesn't have to be perfect. 

You don't have to be perfect.

I've struggled with this a lot, especially amassing a following. It's easy to fall into the trap of wanting it all to be perfect. Instagram is a highlight reel. It's hard to show the messy, dirty, nitty gritty, day to day life. 

I've had quite the hiatus of trying to figure out my relationship to Reduce What You Produce but the reality is that it's me. It's my life, it's my journey. I'm giving up the pressure of having to prove myself to anyone. I'm just going to show up, and try to be the better version of who I was yesterday. 

It's not perfect but, it's beautiful, and: it's freeing.

Phthalates: Linked to reproductive issues, fertility issues, asthma, type II diabetes, and more

Fragrance: A term that can contain over 100 ingredients and allows companies to hide ingredients (often including phthalates)

Grab your shampoo and look at the labels. See if you find any of the above listed ingredients. Also check for Sodium Laureth Sulfate and Sodium Lauryl Sulfate.

Eu resolvi pesquisar melhor sobre o uso do vinagre na lavagem de roupas. Veja a√≠ embaixo o que eu encontrei:

Uma parte do sab√£o que √© utilizado na lavagem das roupas se liga a √°gua a outra se liga a gordura (como qu√≠mica mesmo e a polaridade, positivo e negativo).

No enx√°gue das roupas, uma parte do sab√£o sai levando √°gua e gordura. Mas h√° um residual que ainda fica na roupa. E √© a√≠ que o vinagre entra.

O vinagre funciona retirando  esse res√≠duo do sab√£o das roupas. E ainda confere maciez as fibras do tecido.

Isso acontece pq o √°cido ac√©tico tem a fun√ß√£o de neutralizar a alcalinidade do sab√£o.

O amaciante tamb√©m tem a fun√ß√£o de retirar os res√≠duos de sab√£o das fibras. Mas o vinagre √© beeeeeeem mais em conta e biodegrad√°vel.

Quem disse tudo isso foi o coordenador do N√∫cleo Alquimia do Instituto de Qu√≠mica da Universidade Paulista "J√∫lio de Mesquita Filho" (Unesp), campus Araraquara, Rodrigo Fernando Costa Marques, numa entrevista para a UOL.

Os amaciantes tradicionais industrializados cont√©m coisas absurdas que s√£o prejudiciais a nossa sa√∫de e tamb√©m ao meio ambiente.

Para utilizar o vinagre nas lavagens n√£o tem segredo, n√£o √© necess√°rio a dilui√ß√£o do produto, mas √© recomendado usar 100ml para cada 5kg de roupa.

A roupa n√£o fica com cheiro de vinagre. Na verdade, n√£o h√° cheiro algum. Voc√™ sentir√° apenas o residual do sab√£o - o que √© at√© bom para quem prefere sentir o cheiro do perfume ou para aqueles que n√£o suportam cheiros fortes.

Caso queira algum cheirinho nas roupas basta adicionar algum aroma. Preocupe-se em utilizar algo natural.

This is us! We wanted to do a post just detailing who we are! We are just average people, in normal jobs with normal lives!

We have been married for 3 years now and it was off the back of our honeymoon we decided to go vegan. After lots of research into the meat and dairy industry we just could not continue pumping money into such a disgraceful, shocking industry. We toyed with the idea of vegetarianism first but just decided to go cold turkey (excuse the pun) and ditch the lot. I can honestly say niether of us will ever go back! We do it for the animals. We do it for our and our sons health and we do it for the environment.

Our plastic free journey is more recent. It is only this year we have decided to cut out plastic so we are still learning about this and it can be a long process but we are both fully committed to making the world a better place for us and our family and everyone!

We started this page to help show people that it can be done, one step at a time! We wanted to show people that your average, normal family can make change with the right support and guidance and we want others to follow us on our journey and hopefully start a journey of their own and ultimately live The Kinder Way.

WASTE FREE // FRIDAY FAILURE // how would you dispose of this packaging?

Would you compost it? Do you have access to an industrial composting facility?

Would you recycle it?

Would you put it in the trash (either landfill or incinerator, depending on your community)?

You‚Äôre not alone if you‚Äôre worried you don‚Äôt know the right answer!

I bet you and I will answer this question differently.

In fact, I bet I‚Äôll get a lot of different answers in the comments... here‚Äôs your chance to practice failing and write your best guess in the comments! Quick before you read my interpretation below...

Our waste infrastructure and communication related to waste is CONFUSING!

Every town, county, state, and country handles landfill, incineration, recycling, and compost a little differently and there are very few standard definitions or words that we use in common!

Here‚Äôs how I interpret this label:

1. If you have a creative way to reuse this packaging, you should!

2. If you have access to a commercial composting facility, you can compost this packaging.

3. If you have a home compost pile, you could try composting it and see if it breaks down.

4. If you normally recycle paper, you should NOT recycle this packaging. The paper is lined with what appears to be plastic, but is really a bio-film. Either way, that plastic-y lining is not recyclable.

5. So that means most of us will have to dispose of this packaging as ‚Äúgarbage‚Äù in the landfill or incinerator.

I‚Äôm equally parts happy that companies like this are trying to use better materials and FRuSTraTeD at the lack of infrastructure in our country to support them!

How do you feel when you read a label like this?

Veggie empanadas!

(I am not a chef, don't judge lol) 

 So first,  get all your beautiful veggies of choice together and cut them up and cook them. Season them how you like! 

I took a selfie with the seasoning because I am trying out new seasonings that don't support a certain American president üòÇüòÇ(my seasoning contained dehydrated chicken, which i didn't know until after I made them, but you can use whatever seasoning you like!) 

Now on to the empanadas. I use pre-made pie crusts because its easy and I have no idea how to make real empanada dough lol!  Roll out your crusts and cut them into circles. I reccomend using a butter container lid or a yogurt tub lid, similar to a cookie cutter! (reuse your plastics for good!) 

Then put your veggies inside and create your empanada by putting the rest of the dough over the veggies and close it up. Bake them according to the directions for the pie crusts on the box!

I've been trying to limit my meat consumption for the planet and thought I would share my recipes, even though they are extremely informal. I want to show that this can be easier than you think. You don't have to spend crazy amounts of money or learn super new things. And it can be fun!

Separate waste collection

Why separate waste?

Sustainable development requires waste management in line with the principles of environmental protection, social acceptability and efficiency. We may safely say that there is a general agreement that avoiding waste should be our primary action. The waste that is impossible to avoid should be reused whenever possible under balanced environmental and economic conditions. For this purpose, it is especially important to collect waste separately (by types) wherever waste is generated for a twofold reason:Separate reusable types of waste (paper, glass, cardboard, biowaste, plastic and so on) in order to recycle or recover them, andSeparate hazardous waste (oil, batteries, medicines, chemicals and so on) in order to detoxify and recycle/recover.

‚ú®Hello!‚ú®
Its been a while since I‚Äôve introduced myself (maybe 2 years?), so I thoughts I‚Äôd start fresh. My name is Morganne, but I go by many nicknames, including Mogi (pronounced Mow-gee) by my family. I LOVE THE EARTH and THE PEOPLE ON IT and my overall life goal is to help my two loves connect and work togetherüå±. I created this page to collaborate with people about sustainability, nature, and self care because I believe that we need each topic to be central to our lives to thrive and build a stronger global community! I‚Äôm so glad you are here to hang out with me and learn about some super important topics.

Here are a few fun facts about me and my page:

‚ôªÔ∏è I love to #upcycle waste into wonders! I am deeply exploring this topic right now, as you can see in my last two posts! My favorite material to upcycle is plastic. See the earrings that I am wearing? I made these out of plastic bottles! 

‚úåüèºI am on a #zerowaste journey and it‚Äôs NOT EASY, especially with COVID-19 restrictions, BUT... I love the challenge and the community that comes with it on Instagram.

üë©‚Äçüéì I am going to graduate school very soon at @UCSB to study the environment and how we can communicate more effectively about sustainably. Very excited about this, since I‚Äôve been dreaming about this for over a year now. 

‚ú°Ô∏è I‚Äôm Jewish! This is a part of my identity that I think is important to include in my perspective on sustainability and the current antisemitism affecting the world.

‚úäüèº‚úäüèΩ‚úäüèø I am passionate about environmental justice! As a Jewish person, I have seen and learned about oppression and discrimination before and through the holocaust, into today. I don‚Äôt want it to exist for anyone. Today we face a world with racism and discrimination of people of color, women, LGBTQA, and more groups. I acknowledge my privilege as a white person, face my biases everyday and ALWAYS stand up (and say something!) for equality and justice. If we address inequality head on, we can truly save the environment and create a healthy place for anyone to thrive. 

Have any questions for me? Ask away in the comments! See you soon!

From a sustainable living perspective, it could be a positive insight into what coronavirus has brought to us: COVID-19 crisis has not only affected the reduction of carbon emission, but also our lifestyles.
¬†
During the lockdown and stay-at-home period, people tend to be walking and cycling more, preferring short trips near home instead of long-distance travelling. Additionally, purchasing behaviour has also changed at this time. ‚ÄúThey also bought more local, favouring ties with the local community over shopping in distant, impersonal malls,‚Äù¬†said Wendel Trio, Director of Climate Action Network (CAN) Europe.

ü•¨Brown leaves added last year are not breaking down.
Brown green balance is a term used to describe the ratio of two necessary elements needed in the decomposition process: carbon and nitrogen. Microbes prefer a carbon to nitrogen (C:N) ratio of 30:1 to do their best work. The ‚Äúbrowns‚Äù (or carbons), include leaves, dry grasses, straw, pine needles, or sawdust. The greens are nitrogen rich materials like grass clippings, kitchen waste, or manures. Even if your ratio is slightly off, the material will still decompose, but if you want the product to compost quickly the closer you‚Äôll have to be with the ratio. A good rule of thumb when eyeballing your compost is two browns to every green.
ü•¨Solution:
If the brown leaves are not breaking down, add half as many greens to the pile. Mix in and soak thoroughly.

In July 1990, 13 red kites had to be flown into England from Spain

Thirty years later, nearly 2,000 breeding pairs of red kites soar over England, in what is considered as one of the most successful reintroduction projects in the world

In the 1980s, anyone wanting to see a red kite had to visit a handful of sites. Today it is a daily sight for millions of people. In a few short decades we have taken a species from the brink of extinction to the UK being home to almost 10% of the entire world population. It might be the biggest species success story in UK conservation history

Good news is that some food and beverage industries will in this year provide consumers with carbon emission information for their products, just like what food nutrition label does.
¬†
Why are food carbon labels important? Data shows that food production creates 26% of global carbon emissions. It tells us what food we consume matters to our environment, but many of us have no idea about what we should do because of the unavailable carbon emission information on food products.
¬†
Now as the carbon emission information can be more easily received, we can improve our awareness of carbon emissions and manage our environmental impact through choosing low-carbon food.
¬†

Hi, hi! I'm back in my little apartment in D.C and so excited to show you my #thriftedfurniture. Fast furniture, like fast fashion, is problematic on many fronts. It is the second largest source of urban waste in the U.S., it is hard to recycle (it contains formaldehyde, laminate, etc) and takes a lot of harvested trees + fossil fuels to create. So when you move a lot (like me), and in a way that's not easy to carry furniture with you (moving across oceans, continents , countries), what do you do? 
.
.
1. Buy as much furniture second hand as you can. In the U.S., I love Habitat ReStore and Goodwill. All the chairs, couches, bookshelves and little tables in this photo are from these two stores, and together cost less than USD 250. In India, I love gozefo.com. They deliver and unpack at your house, which is great. 
.
.
2. Ensure that you are disposing off furniture responsibly when you leave your old place - I sold everything on FB / donated things that did not sell to Goodwill when I moved out of Cambridge a few years ago, and handed over all my furniture to my cousins who took over my lease when I left Bombay last year. It takes a bit more time to find new homes for your furniture but totally worth it! 
.
.
.
.
.
.

~ Plastic Free~

Plastic-free July is almost over but I‚Äôve been practicing this lifestyle for over four years now. I‚Äôm still growing and learning in trying to do my part with the fight to save our planet.

You can too. Going plastic-free can be a change you do at your own speed. Whether it‚Äôs a small daily change, weekly or even monthly. Any change is a good chance.

Example of a small change, instead of using cling plastic wrap you can use parchment paper.

I actually bread my banana bread without flouring or greasing my pan, I also was able to use it to store my bread afterward. So that‚Äôs two uses from one product.

1- Compreens√£o de que o mundo est√° conectado.
Apesar de fechar suas fronteiras a fim de reduzir a velocidade de cont√°gio, os pa√≠ses perceberam que s√≥ ser√° poss√≠vel eliminar o risco da Covid-19 quando todos os pa√≠ses conseguirem controlar o v√≠rus. A seguran√ßa de cada pa√≠s depende, em boa parte, da estabilidade do resto do planeta.
‚†Ä
2- O trabalho remoto ser√° um grande trunfo para o planeta.

‚†Ä
3- Menos ar condicionado e mais janelas abertas.

4- Cr√≠tica √† produ√ß√£o industrial de animais.
A revista cient√≠fica American Journal of Public Health alertou, em editorial de 2007, que a produ√ß√£o industrial de animais poderia ser a origem da pr√≥xima grande pandemia. A Covid-19 provavelmente veio de pr√°ticas de armazenar animais selvagens sem condi√ß√µes de higiene, para consumo humano.
‚†Ä
5- Viver melhor.
Essa experi√™ncia forte j√° est√° levando algumas pessoas a valorizar as rela√ß√µes humanas, a fam√≠lia e pequenos prazeres do dia-a-dia. Haver√° um resgate de estilos de vida simples, mais focados nas rela√ß√µes humanas, na sa√∫de e na felicidade, e menos na acumula√ß√£o de bens.

I forgot about plastic free July!
.
Please excuse my manky bath matt. One of the easiest plastic free swaps for me was ditching the face wipes and cotton pads. 
.
In our house we no longer have kitchen roll, face wipes or cotton pads. Confession time, I have 1 travel sized pack of pads for nail varnish remover, but once I buy more pads I think I will keep my older ones for that. Everything is reusable. I got these adorable patterns from @turtley_eco y(you'll notice most of my plastic free stuff comes from there.)
.
I love it when I wash everything and pop them all on the washing line, it looks like bunting. The pads come with a little bag that you pop them in and tie and pop in the washing machine. Honestly I feel so much better and less wasteful using these. Also, face wipes are no good for your face either! Stop using them now and save for emergencies! 
.

With the deadlines approaching to rapidly reduce emissions, it is clear that the children of today will not live in a carbon intensive world when they‚Äôre older. They simply can‚Äôt afford too. To keep warming below 1.5 degrees above pre-industrial levels, a person born today can only emit one eighth of lifetime emissions compared to someone born in 1950.‚Å†
‚Å†
To keep warming below 1.5 degrees, which is considered to be the threshold before the climate really starts to wreak havoc, global emissions need to peak this year, 2020. Emissions then have to fall around 50% by 2030 and to below zero by 2055. This scenario requires a huge amount of negative emissions being deployed (afforestation, technology etc.). However, many countries are not doing enough to see these targets met so children born today may need to emit even less than this new study suggests.‚Å†
‚Å†
However, as this study by Carbon Brief points out, every country has a different carbon footprint and therefore individual emissions over their lifetime are hard to make blanket statements for. For example, someone from India only emits 1.9 tonnes of co2 per year on average, however this number is 16.9 for someone from the United States. And to continue on from that, countries such as the UK and the USA have much larger historical emissions than many other nations.‚Å†
‚Å†
Hopefully richer nations and people who have benefited from a lifestyle and system that caused the climate crisis will begin to show strong leadership. Hence why it is so important that we all continue to make sure we elect governments that will act on climate, not give massive bailouts to the fossil fuel industry.‚Å†
‚Å†
Help us reach more people so we can make sure that everyone can make informed decisions about climate change moving forward, please share our posts and page!‚Å†
‚Å†
Source; Carbon Brief‚Å†
‚Å†

I was shocked to find out that "on average, litter pickers recorded 4.8 pieces of period waste for every 100M of beach. This equates to almost two million items when mapped against the UK coastline". Sourced from @natracare (who can I please add- produce quality organic, plastic-free and biodegradable period products üëå).

Flushing pads and tampons down the toilet is compromising our environment and endangering our wildlife. They should always be disposed of in an appropriate bin.

However, even when being disposabled of correctly  disposable plastic menstrual products will end up in landfill and will take approximately 500 years to break down! üò•

As terrible as this is, there is good news! There are so many alternative menstrual products out there now which are more sustainable and eco-friendly. Avaliable online and some in supermarkets. 

Not only that, they can be better for your body with the lack of plastic ingredients being present and *kerching*... reusable products can save you money!üí∞

Alternatives include:

‚úÖ Washable menstrual pads
‚úÖ Reusable menstrual cups
‚úÖ Washable period pants
‚úÖ Menstrual discs
‚úÖ Menstrual sea sponges
‚úÖ Reusable tampon applicators
‚úÖ Leak-proof period clothing
‚úÖ Biodegradable and plastic-free disposable period products

Como reciclar de um jeito simples? Quem dera se existisse uma f√≥rmula m√°gica que funcionasse para todos, simples e f√°cil! Apesar de n√£o existir, seguindo alguns conceitos b√°sicos, pode-se se tornar mais simples e at√© prazeroso a reciclagem. Voc√™ quer saber como? Primeiramente, vou te dar tr√™s dicas:
‚†Ä
Primeira: os recicl√°veis devem ser separados em duas partes: os secos e √∫midos, para evitar contamina√ß√£o entre eles.
‚†Ä
Segunda: Como geralmente armazenamos os recicl√°veis secos por alguns dias em casa, antes de descart√°-los, devemos nos atentar aos restos que sobram dentro dos frascos. Nesse sentido, acabam gerando certos desconfortos, pois causam mau cheiro, podendo atrair insetos e roedores, principalmente baratas e formigas.
‚†Ä
Terceira: Sabemos que os recicl√°veis ocupam muito espa√ßo, e que nem sempre temos sobrando em casa e muito menos para quem mora em apartamento. Sabemos que isso acaba influenciando diretamente na hora de reciclar.
‚†Ä
 
Se voc√™ abrir a caixa, no espa√ßo que cabia apenas uma, agora cabe mais de cinco. Isso mesmo! Do mesmo modo, a garrafa PET de refrigerante est√° ocupando muito espa√ßo. Que tal dobrar ela? Agora no espa√ßo de uma, cabem tr√™s.
‚†Ä
Al√©m destas dicas te ajudarem a reciclar e evitar situa√ß√µes desagrad√°veis com o mau cheiro, bichos e insetos, e economizar muito espa√ßo no acondicionamento, ajudar√° muito toda a cadeia dos materiais recicl√°veis. Assim como beneficiar√° os catadores e coletores, os dep√≥sitos de sucatas, as pessoas que fazem a triagem destas mat√©rias e o meio ambiente.
‚†Ä
Uma das coisas interessantes nisso √© que atrav√©s da sua atitude de reciclar da forma correta e consciente, vai transformar uma cadeia inteira, beneficiando n√£o s√≥ as pessoas que dependem da reciclagem, mas o meio ambiente tamb√©m.

DOMINION is an Australian documentary released in 2018 by #ChrisDelforce. The film shows the many ways in which animals are regularly abused. A total of six facets are illuminated: farm animals, wild animals, companion animals, entertainment animals, fur animals, and animal experimentation.
-
Dominion uses drones, hidden and handheld cameras to expose the dark underbelly of modern animal agriculture, questioning the morality and validity of humankind‚Äôs dominion over the animal kingdom. While mainly focusing on animals used for food, it also explores other ways animals are exploited and abused by humans, including clothing, entertainment and research.
-
Narrated by #JoaquinPhoenix, #RooneyMara, #Sia, #SadieSink and #KatVonD, and co-produced by #Earthlings creator #ShaunMonson. Filmed in #Australia, with a global message.

Below the surface - Containers.

Part 6 of my series with @sarah.robertson.barnes , going beyond the simple swaps to underlying issues and next steps.

Leftovers, packed lunches, take-out, delivery. When we think of these things, we don‚Äôt see the food, instead it‚Äôs the containers! 

Although some containers are reusable (still plastic), and some are recyclable, containers still have the potential to end up in landfills. Recycling programs vary by municipality, and there is never a guarantee that what you throw in the blue bin will be recycled properly, or recycled at all. Even cardboard recycling is overburdened by the online shopping industry!

Below the surface, recycling can oftentimes end up in landfills. And landfills in Canada tend to be near communities of colour or Indigenous communities, compromising people‚Äôs health with toxic waterways, poor air quality and garbage. Internationally, wealthy countries ship garbage and/or recycling to developing countries. 

Both of these examples are a form of environmental racism: with little other economic opportunity, less wealthy communities take the brunt of cities‚Äô excessive waste. As a result, many urbanites are also detached from where their garbage goes, therefore producing more and more garbage without personal consequence. 

The change is in your actions: Make use of your space and the items in your house or apartment. Containers previously used for food, like a pickle jar, can continue being used for food in the fridge OR freezer (yes- jars can be frozen- just don‚Äôt fill liquids to the top!). A sour cream container could become a seedling container. Cardboard boxes can be stored for future use/storage. If you have a need, look around first: what do I have that can be repurposed? 

You can also take action by shopping mindfully. When you are making purchases, remember that you‚Äôre paying for the packaging as well as its content: can it be reused in some way? 

Bigger picture, the issue of landfill locations undermining community health is also an issue of under-representation in local politics. Whose voices are being left out of the conversation?

Ik ben Else Marij. Na mijn studie aan de HBO-V ben ik gaan werken als @kinderverpleegkundige_wakz Daar is de interesse ontstaan voor de unieke en veerkrachtige band tussen ouder&kind; om deze te ondersteunen in tijden waarin zorgen zijn. De stappen erna (kinderthuiszorg, @centrumvoorjeugdengezin_ en werken in een huis voor kinderen met ernstige trauma en hechting problematiek) kwamen voort uit het verlangen om iets te betekenen in die ouder&kind relatie. 

Van mijn veertig levensjaren (hiep _hoera; dit jaar!) ken ik al ruim dertig jaar Jantine. Het samen starten van kinderpraktijk @villa_hoep was een stap die dankbaar logisch voelde. 
En dertig jaar iemand kennen of net een jaar; dat maakt soms geen verschil. In de ontmoeting met Saskia van @rouwloods is er een bijzonder inspirerende samenwerking ontstaan. 

...met plezier blijven we ons ontwikkelen in ons aanbod voor gezinnen, scholen en organisaties. Onze bespreekmomenten doen we met fijne taartjes, eindeloze afwegingen en blije, trotse hoera‚Äôs! 

Ik gun het gezinnen, instellingen en scholen dat ze het gesprek over de dood kunnen hebben binnen een veilige omgeving. Met misschien een lach, een traan, met creativiteit en alle verlegenheid die je soms kunt hebben. Misschien wel met een taartje ;-)

Ik ben moeder van drie, getrouwde met Jaap, en om ons heen huppelt hulphond Vos. (Klinkt dat niet idyllisch) Een dynamisch gezin maakt mij dankbaar; _een zelfgeplukte bloem in een vaasje, _kikkerdril op de salontafel in mijn leuke kringloopschaal (brrr), _chaos in huis vanwege creatieve kinderen vol ideeeÃàn, en _stille momentjes helemaal alleen. Rust vindt ik bij God die onvoorwaardelijk van mij houdt. 
Zouden omstandigheden die soms ingewikkeld zijn je wellicht dankbaar maken!? Zo ervaar ik het wel. Dankbaar voor mijn gezin, dankbaar dat wij met @torisdood een verschil kunnen maken!

Hi everyone, I apologize for being slightly quiet during plastic free July! 

I just wanted to talk about how little changes are just as significant as a complete shift in lifestyle.

I was looking at nuts in the reduced section and spotted some heavily packaged snack boxes which I was tempted to purchase. I then noticed these lower down and favoured them instantly. I often keep my eyes peeled for things like this, a mindset that comes with time. 

It's okay if you are feeling overwhelmed during this time and purchase things wrapped in plastic. We are all doing our best. Just consider moments like this a win and be proud of the progress you are making.

Conventional cleaning products can contain some very strong chemicals ‚Äì¬†including some harmful ones. Common chemicals in cleaners have been linked to a range of human health harm, from reproductive problems like fertility issues and birth defects, hormone disruption, breast cancer, asthma and other respiratory problems, and allergies.
The kicker is that cleaning product companies aren‚Äôt required by law to list all the ingredients in their cleaners, so people haven‚Äôt even had the information they needed¬†to try to figure out which ones are safer. That‚Äôs begun to change recently thanks to the work of groups like Women‚Äôs Voices for the Earth. Unfortunately, most companies are still keeping fragrance ingredients a secret, where toxic chemicals like phthalates, musks, and styrene can lurk.

Many people don't understand the idea of minimalism. They think if they can't get rid of a certain object they can't be minimalists. However, the idea of minimalism is not to get rid of all your stuff and see how you can live with little left. But instead to ensure that all things in your home, in your life have a certain value from having. That is why minimalism will always mean a different thing for every person. What you find valuable might not be for another person. Minimalism is not about what you own, it is about why you own it.

Crazy, isn't it? ü§î
.
üëÄ: Sand the top layer of paint off of an aluminum can. Open the can and use a wooden rod to suspend it in a suitably-sized beaker. üî•
.
‚ÄºÔ∏è: Add some drain cleaner (usually a 10% sodium or potassium hydroxide solution). üëá
.
Observe a tumultuous reaction and release of gas. Wait two hours. Take the can out of the liquid. It would seem that the aluminum has completely dissolved, but the drink hasn't leaked out! üò§
.
üò∂: This ordinary aluminum can is concealing a devious secret ‚Äì it is covered with a protective layer not only on the outside, but on the inside as well! When we remove its paint coating, we expose the aluminum, which easily reacts with a drain cleaner that contains an alkaline component. üõë
.
But even when the aluminum has dissolved completely, the drink will not leak out. There is a second material inside the can ‚Äì a layer of plastic that keeps the drink itself from interacting with the aluminum. üò¨
.
.

The Pearl Crescent Butterfly (Phyciodes tharos) is just one of many reasons I do not clean up my gardens in fall and choose to wait until early after the last hard frost. Their eggs are laid in small batches on underside of leaves of their host plants‚Äô (smooth-leaved true asters including Aster pilosus, A. texanus, and A. laevis). ‚Å£
‚Å£
Their Caterpillars eat the leaves and then find fallen leaves or holes in hollowed plant stalks to spend the winter in hibernation.  Nectar sources for adult butterflies include a great variety of flowers including dogbane, swamp milkweed, shepherd's needle, asters, and winter cress. They‚Äôre not picky! ‚Å£
‚Å£
This little male was waiting around in hopes to find a lady! I can tell he is a male because the males usually have black antennal knobs.

2020 has taught us that you can make milk out of practically anything ü•õ There are so many options on the market now including those above, as well as coconut, pea, hemp, flax, cashew, walnut, and more!
‚†Ä
But why make alternatives to regular milk? Turns out, dairy has a high impact on the environment. Raising a cow for milk requires vast land, constant electricity, thousands of gallons of water and grain ‚Äì and even more water and pesticides are required to grow grain. Moreover, cows create huge amounts of greenhouse gases through their burps and feces (we‚Äôre not kidding), which pollute not only the air but waterways, too.
‚†Ä
Not all plant milk is perfect. One glass of almond milk, for example, requires more water than a typical shower ‚Äì still less than a glass of cow‚Äôs milk! But almond farming practices like monocropping and heavy pesticide use have shown to be really harmful to bees. While some alternatives have their drawbacks, there are still so many environmental benefits of choosing one of the lower impact options.
‚†Ä
What‚Äôs your fave milk option and why?

You‚Äôve probably heard or read or noticed that ever since the COVID-19 shutdown, the air and water all around the planet has gotten cleaner. Yes, nature is rebounding around the world.

Communities across the country have seen examples of increased litter during the coronavirus pandemic -- especially masks and gloves discarded on the ground -- and environmentalists are concerned the increased use of single-use products like masks, gloves, bags and disposable silverware will lead to more plastic waste making its way into the ocean.

The good news are some countries are trying to make some changes in ordee to reduce plastic waste during this pandemic period.France is looking to increase littering fines to combat pollution amid the pandemic. The European Commission is pressing on with its single-use plastics ban despite pressure from lobbyists. And in Australia, an ask for residents to go plastic-free in July.

Los bastoncillos para los oidos son un producto innecesario: No necesitamos usarlos y, de hecho, pueden resultar perjudiciales para la salud.

üò±Aun as√≠, los usamos. Durante, ¬øcuanto? ¬ø1 minuto? Y los tiramos a la basura para tardar 300 a√±os en descomponerse.
¬øL√≥gico? No.

‚ÄºÔ∏èLos bastoncillos suelen acabar en el mar alterando el ecosistema y la vida marina (cada a√±o se recogen 320.000 kg de bastoncillos en las playas europeas). 

‚ùåY, como os dec√≠amos, pueden resultar peligrosos no solo para nuestro entorno, sino para nosotrxs tambi√©n. La Academia Americana de Otorrinolaringolog√≠a no recomienda su uso ya que opina que el cer√∫men es necesario para prevenir la entrada de agentes pat√≥genos y mantiene los o√≠dos hidratados.

‚úÖ¬øAlternativas? No os vamos a recomendar sprays de agua marina, ni el palito de naranjo. Os vamos a recomendar: nada. La mejor alternativa al residuo innecesario es que no usemos nada innecesario. Si no lo necesitamos y puede ser da√±ino, optemos por dejarlo atr√°s.

ü§î¬øY nosotros qu√© usamos? Nosotros seguimos usando bastoncillos porque no predicamos con el ejemplo üòÖ Los usamos una o dos veces a la semana (cuando nos lavamos el pelo) y solo porque el agua en los oidos nos da much√≠sima grima y nos resulta inc√≥moda. Como a√∫n no hemos conseguido pasar totalmente de los bastoncillos (pero lo conseguiremos), desde hace un a√±o usamos estos hechos de bamb√∫ y algod√≥n. 

‚ôªÔ∏èS√≠, a√∫n seguimos generando residuo pero al menos es un residuo completamente biodegradable y siempre ser√° mejor que el pl√°stico.

Starting from the lone peak point of the journey//
This is just a piece of scenery that we witnessed, watching it dance with the everchanging sun rays. They were bringing different rock formations to life, giving the cliff a new face over and over again.
 Sunlight changed from misty yellow to fiery pink in a matter of minutes. We sat on the cliff absorbing the view that was so vast and captivating that our brains just weren't able to comprehend all that visual information. 
  The sunset reminded me of the Restaurant at the End of the Universe (by Douglas Adams) which time turbines slowly rock backward and forward across the crucial moment.
 The guests of the restaurant get to see the end of the world whenever they come, and given the intensity of the experience, I felt like that was exactly what we were witnessing - the sun was colliding with the horizon, the day was withering away - but the world was unfolding. It was a potent, vulnerable moment.
.
.
.
It took some time for the moment to sink in and integrate into my very being. I am saddened by what we're doing to the world (and ourselves). The more I love it, the more every piece of junk, mindlessly thrown, hurts me. How do you deal with a problem so extensive, and with so much to lose? #nature #sunset #ecology #savetheearth #climate #education #ecofriendly #environment #eco #zerowaste #climatechange #ecologie #savetheplanet #biology #green #wildlife #conservation #biodiversity #naturephotography #sustainability #earth #photography #plasticfree #recycle #gogreen #naturelovers #sustainable #pollution #noplastic #bhfyp

READ #ANTARCTICA2020 

Sign the petition. Link in bio

This year, we can secure the largest act of ocean protection in history.

2020 marks the 200th anniversary of the discovery of Antarctica. It is also the year when the highest temperatures ever were recorded on the continent. With melting ice, warming waters, and increased fishing, all of the creatures that live there need us more than ever. But we need Antarctica just as much. This vast icy continent is critical to stabilizing our climate, and it circulates vital ocean nutrients that sustain fish populations, and humans, all over the world.

Did you know that 111 is seen as a lucky number in India? Or that female babies are seen as a financial burden upon families, especially those in poorer regions?
Since 2016, this small Indian village found a way to celebrate newborn girls by planting 111 trees for each female baby born; supporting the community‚Äôs ecological and economical future and fighting against historical female prejudice as they go.
üå¥üå≥üå≤Why trees?üå≥üå≤
The trees provide food, energy, and income to the 8,000 residents of Piplantri and help them to achieve long-term economic and environmental sustainability. Plants also filter the air and help contribute to a higher water level and richer wildlife. What‚Äôs more, the Piplantri people started planting aloe vera next to the trees because it works as a natural pesticide, and this subsequently enabled them to start selling products made of the aloe plant like juice and gel, among other things.
This town is just incredible and so forward thinking (they‚Äôre doing way more than just the tree thing - would definitely recommend checking the full story out via @brightside.official!)

Big Bad Wolf
24x36 in
Acrylic on Canvas
2020

Inspired by the story of ‚ÄúThe three little pigs,‚Äù the artist came up with this artwork titled ‚ÄúBig Bad Wolf.‚Äù This childhood story tells us that in life you must give your fullest when you do something. Laziness is something that should never be honed and adapted because you‚Äôll never know when accidents and tragedies come. Just like what we‚Äôre experiencing today, the pandemic had caused numerous hardships towards plenty of individuals including artists. Plenty of opportunities had been lost and the struggle towards advancement became harder. However this doesn‚Äôt mean that you must let it be without doing any work. No matter how huge and strong bad instances come, we must keep on striving and persevering. Just like how the story went, we‚Äôll only find the best awards when we know we‚Äôve given our all.

FOR & ABOUT SENSITIVE PEOPLE
.
Sometimes I feel like writing and sharing something personal, I don‚Äôt know why it comes but I follow
. Today  I felt overwhelmed looking at Instagram so much information, political madness and happy photos of food that it seems my brain can‚Äôt comprehend anymore. I literally feel nauseous looking at the screen of tv and now at the screen of my phone too. It‚Äôs too much to comprehend for one brain, the range of emotions triggered by posts is crazy- from laugh to cry and back. üò´
I‚Äôm very sensitive and emotional, I cry at movies, I cry a lot, if someone is crying- I‚Äôll cry, if someone feels sad I‚Äôll cry; I‚Äôm happy myself like most of the time but all the pain and injustice around give me actual pain and with age it seems I‚Äôve learnt to control it better but the depth of emotion is getting more intense. To all my sensitive brothers and sisters, I know it‚Äôs a blessing and a curse to feel so much and so deep, but that what makes us closer to others, that what makes us willing to help, to be more aware. 
Sometimes I wish to feel less, for example I physically feel ill in the places with bad vibes, I feel dizzy and nauseous and it come like an alarm for my consciousness that I have to stay alert and protect myself. It‚Äôs very uncomfortable to be honest but it‚Äôs also makes me choose people around me and places to stay wisely. 
üåÖ
I have many friends who are the same, very sensitive, and I love them for being reflections of what‚Äôs going on, I love them for being so careful around people cause they actually feel everyone around. Sometimes we might seem rude cause we have to keep boundaries high around toxic people, cause we feel their pain physically even if it‚Äôs covered by big smile. Its  actually painful to look in the eyes of toxic people, to see the darkness, to see the longing for love and I wish to be able to give all that love, all that love that they are seeking and even more, but sometimes I have to stand up, turn away and walk away very fast and probably lock myself in the room and cry to release your pain.
And maybe it‚Äôs our function - function of highly sensitive people - to take this pain from those who carry it and cry it out!‚û°

Pu√≤, il batter d'ali di una farfalla in Brasile, provocare un tornado in Texas?". Spesso ci avete chiesto cos'√® questo effetto farfalla, anche negli incontri che abbiamo fatto nelle scuole. L'effetto farfalla √® l'idea secondo cui piccole variazioni nelle¬†condizioni iniziali¬†producano grandi variazioni nel comportamento a lungo termine di un¬†sistema. Cosa vuol dire? Per usare la metafora della farfalla: il battito di ali di una farfalla in Brasile sposterebbe le piccole molecole di aria intorno a s√© e questa piccola variazione, con un effetto a catena sulle molecole di aria via via pi√π distanti, potrebbe causare una grossa variazione in Texas, come un tornado. Cosa c'entra con il clima magari vi state chiedendo? La conseguenza pratica dell'effetto farfalla √® che i¬†sistemi complessi, come il¬†clima, sono molto difficili da prevedere su una scala di tempo utile. Questo perch√© ogni modello che tenti di¬†simulare¬†un sistema deve necessariamente eliminare alcune¬†informazioni¬†sulle condizioni iniziali, e qui torniamo ad esempio alla nostra farfalla: quando si simula il tempo atmosferico, non √® possibile includere anche lo spostamento d'aria causato da ogni singola farfalla. In conclusione quindi, l'effetto farfalla viene utilizzato come metafora per far capire a tutti quanto sia complesso lo studio dei fenomeni climatici.

Today I‚Äôm thinking about the wellbeing of the planet. It‚Äôs ‚ÄúPlastic Free July‚Äù so I thought I‚Äôd share a couple of the ways I minimise plastic use.

I‚Äôm always on the lookout for new ideas and shops/suppliers that support the plastic-free initiative, so please do let me know if you have any good tips or know of any good zero waste shops/products/suppliers.

Firstly, a really easy one‚Ä¶ rather than buying new handpump bottles of soap each time they run out, I buy an eco-refill from the supermarket. This example from Carex uses 75% less plastic than the original bottle. It‚Äôs a no brainer ‚Äì it takes less than a minute to empty one of these refils into an existing soap dispenser.

My second tip, and I‚Äôve used these for a few years now, is beeswax and cotton food wraps, which I use instead of clingfilm. They are washable, biodegradable and they have the benefit of having the natural anti-bacterial properties of beeswax, which will help keep your food fresh. I simply use the warmth of my hands to make the wrap more malleable, secure the wrap over the top of a bowl, or wrap it directly around food. And then as the wrap cools, it holds its shape and creates a seal. You can‚Äôt expose these wraps to hot temperatures or put them in the microwave - nor should you use them on raw meat or fish - but for everything else ‚Äì superb! And then you can use cold water and a mild detergent to wash them/wipe them down after use.

What have you been using in place of unnecessary plastics?

Should I care about choosing environmentally friendly painted products including environmentally friendly furniture? üåé VOC‚Äôs, or volatile organic compounds, are compounds that easily become vapors or gasses and are emitted from many of the everyday household cleaners & paints available on the market today & that many of us buy.  Breathing them in affects our health so it IS good to be aware and use the available research in our buying decisions.

An excerpt from Time magazine 2019 explains: ‚ÄúExperts are still figuring out just how these chemicals harm the human body. But research has found that some of them can be absorbed into the blood through contact with the skin or through inhalation, and that they can accumulate in the brain or organs of those who are exposed. The liver also breaks down some of these chemicals into byproducts that can bind to and potentially interfere with a cell‚Äôs genetic material.

The take-home message from all this research is that paint is potentially toxic‚Äîespecially for ‚Äúvulnerable‚Äù groups such as pregnant women, young children and the elderly. VOC levels are usually much higher indoors than out, especially if those indoor areas are not well ventilated. And wet or drying paint‚Äîparticularly oil-based paints‚Äîtend to emit a lot of VOCs, says Clifford Weisel, a professor at the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute of Rutgers University‚Äù. 

VOC‚Äôs are found in:
Paints and thinners
Adhesives
Hobby and craft supplies
Dry cleaning fluids
Glues
Wood preservatives
Cleaners and disinfectants
Moth repellants
Air fresheners
Building materials and furnishings
Copy machines and printers

Furniture you buy from Condover Furniture Ltd based in Condover, just outside of Shrewsbury, Shropshire, and shipping nationwide, uses only top quality environmentally friendly primers & paints and Osmo waxes & oils which leave an environmentally friendly finish.

We also upcycle quality wooden furniture so prolonging the life of existing products and saving landfill.

In addition a percentage of the purchase price benefits charity.

Aloe Ever-Shield by Forever Living is a completely natural deodorant, free of aluminum compounds and other chemicals harmful to health. Its main ingredient is aloe vera. The action of aloe vera is multidirectional, it not only allows you to get rid of the bad smell, but also soothes the skin irritated by epilation.
The action of aloe is based on the alleviation of excessive sweating of the skin and the reduction of the multiplication of bacteria feeding on sweat.

This product can be used even immediately after depilation of the armpits, because the aloe contained in the composition soothes irritated skin, softens it and brings relief. Forever Aloe Stick protects clothing against unsightly stains, both on light and dark clothes.

Our deodorant is recommended also by oncology clinic in London.
Message me for more details how to join Forever or to get yours.

Preparaci√≥n

Para preparar la base ponemos en la licuadora todos los ingredientes a temperatura ambiente y batimos hasta conseguir una masa pegajosa. Podemos triturarlo m√°s o menos seg√∫n las preferencias personales, para notar las almendras m√°s enteras o no.
*
Hacemos una base en los moldes y dejamos enfriar en el congelador mientras preparamos el relleno.
*
Para el relleno, ponemos todos los ingredientes en la batidora y batimos hasta que quede una masa uniforme.
*
A√±adimos la mezcla con cuidado en el molde, sobre la base, y decoramos con las frambuesas. Metemos de nuevo en el congelador.
*
Preparamos el chocolate para la decoraci√≥n calentando el chocolate junto con la cucharadita de aceite de coco en el microondas o al ba√±o mar√≠a hasta que quede l√≠quido. Dejar enfriar el chocolate antes de ponerlo sobre la mezcla ya que si est√° muy caliente la puede estropear.
*
Cuando lo tenemos a temperatura ambiente, con ayuda de una cuchara, decoramos los bocaditos con el chocolate.
*
Dejamos enfriar en la nevera al menos cinco horas o toda la noche.
*

We came up with the idea of You Do You ‚Äì Eco from our own eco journey, which I found confusing.‚Å†
.‚Å†
I felt like Alice falling down the rabbit hole. I wanted to try everything that might help, but products can often be expensive. Where to start? Why this one over that one? I joined Facebook groups and at first felt I wouldn‚Äôt be able to be as eco as other people were being. As they were doing it better than me, would my contribution make a difference? ‚Å†
.‚Å†
They made me feel guilty that I couldn‚Äôt afford to change my whole way of life in one switch. That is when I came up with the idea of You Do You - Eco. It is more about doing what you can, when you can and not to feel guilty about the fact you can only afford to change small things each month or even every other month. ‚Å†
.‚Å†
A thousand people being eco imperfectly, is so much better than ten people being eco perfectly. Is there even a perfect way to do anything. No, as my perfect is different from your perfect!! You do you and be proud of who you are! We want to empower you to feel great about your decisions and the way you live your life. üåçüíö‚Å†
.‚Å†

Ok, hands up who has ever forgotten their reusable shopping bag when they pop to the shops?? I know I've forgotten literally dozens of times.
Simple plastic free swap? Lots of supermarkets will have a supply of cardboard boxes if you need to transport your shopping, if they aren't readily available you can always ask. Apakah ini masa depan yang kita inginkan? üò±

Para ahli memperkirakan, lima tahun lagi, atau pada tahun 2025, rasio plastik dibanding ikan di samudra akan menjadi 1:3. 

Lalu pada tahun 2050, karena plastik akan terakumulasi terus dan terus di laut, akan ada lebih banyak plastik dibandingkan ikan. Kita akan berenang bersama sampah plastik. Literally.

Laporan dari Credit Suisse menyimpulkan seperti ini: "bobot dan volume plastik di lautan akan melebihi total volume seluruh ikan pada 2050."

Mungkin banyak di antara kita yang sudah tidak akan ada lagi pada tahun 2050. Tapi bagaimana dengan anak cucu kita dan generasi-generasi sesudahnya?

Bueno MGF Peptide Serum
Serum vitalitas ini mengandung 50% EGF Complex. Bueno MGF Peptide Serum telah di sertifikasi oleh Badan Makanan dan Obat-Obatan dapat memperbaiki kerutan pada kulit kering karna mengandung Adenosine.

Kandungannya

Peptide
Peptide adalah Bio-Material dengan keamanan tinggi yang sangat baik dalam menghilangkan keriput, Melembabkan kulit, Memperbaiki kulit yang rusak dan melindunginya.Peptide mempunyai partikel yang kecil yang dapat menembus jauh ke dalam kulit yang sangat efektif untuk memperbaiki kulit.

Adenosine 
Adenosine Berfungsi sebagai Anti-Imflamasi dan memperbaiki kerutan. Mencegah penuaan pada kulit dengan mensintesis protein dan kolagen di dalam kulit serta meningkatkan kekuatan pada kulit. Adenosine juga memiliki fungsi untuk menyembuhkan jerawat dan masalah kulit berminyak.

Hey Everyone, So today's post is all about Sustainable Living. Back in February, I set myself a challenge and did #Ecofeb2020. I made one sustainable change each day for the month of February, and it actually went really well. I was quite surprised if I'm honest. The only challenge I found I couldn't keep up was shopping only at farmers' markets. From an economic point of view, I just couldn't afford it every week, but I am hoping that I can visit  @milkmarketlimerick at least once a month, now that it has reopened. 
_
My little challenge was what actually inspired me to set my website. I have created a category called sustainable living. To me, to live sustainably means that I consider environmental aspects, economic stability, and social factors such as ethics when making decisions. Meatless Monday, supporting local business, and choosing to only drink ethically sources coffee. Sustainable living means I have a fulfilled life all while being conscious of the long term goal for our planet.I have a blog post entitled; How to Live a Sustainable Lifestyle where I shared my experience of #Ecofeb2020. The link is in my Bio if interested in having read. 
_
The second picture represents what sustainable living means to me, as it is such a  personal thing, I would love to know what does it mean to you?

Bueno MGF Peptide Serum
Serum vitalitas ini mengandung 50% EGF Complex. Bueno MGF Peptide Serum telah di sertifikasi oleh Badan Makanan dan Obat-Obatan dapat memperbaiki kerutan pada kulit kering karna mengandung Adenosine.

Kandungannya

Peptide
Peptide adalah Bio-Material dengan keamanan tinggi yang sangat baik dalam menghilangkan keriput, Melembabkan kulit, Memperbaiki kulit yang rusak dan melindunginya.Peptide mempunyai partikel yang kecil yang dapat menembus jauh ke dalam kulit yang sangat efektif untuk memperbaiki kulit.

Adenosine 
Adenosine Berfungsi sebagai Anti-Imflamasi dan memperbaiki kerutan. Mencegah penuaan pada kulit dengan mensintesis protein dan kolagen di dalam kulit serta meningkatkan kekuatan pada kulit. Adenosine juga memiliki fungsi untuk menyembuhkan jerawat dan masalah kulit berminyak.

C L E A N  A I R  A C T 

NEWSFLASH- UK Research and Innovation has just awarded ¬£3 million to support six research networks, including one at Cambridge, that will investigate solutions to air pollution.

The funding will support multidisciplinary research networks that will address future air quality challenges at the indoor-outdoor interface.

Poor air quality is the largest environmental risk to public health in the UK, according to DEFRA‚Äôs Clean Air Strategy. The new multidisciplinary networks will drive forward research and innovation to help tackle major air quality challenges within both indoor and outdoor spaces including home, school, work, and public transport.

The topics will include: exposure to airborne biological material; urban and building ventilation design; air quality impacts of decarbonisation and low emission transport; and protection for groups most at risk, including designing healthy schools.

Decarbonisation and the drive to net zero suggest future scenarios where road traffic pollution is reduced, new buildings become increasingly sealed for energy efficiency, and people spend more time indoors as they work and study at home using technology to stay connected. This will increase the importance and influence of indoor air pollution on outdoor air quality, and vice versa, and on our health.

Magic & logic in business
Personally, I am a very strategic person with "strong logical reasoning skills", as an assessment showed when I wanted to find out which course of studies to persue. My intention was to find out if I possessed #creative talent. They couldn¬¥t find any. OMG, can you imagine?
So I chose physics and I know now what I had done. After my father had died in a car crash on the way to one of the building sites he oversaw at the time, I fled into my head, distanced myself from the ache in my heart.
Today, I feel a lot of compassion for the little girl I was. She was only 10 years old, my artist child, as I have come to call her. She holds the key to my inspiration and creativity.
Today, I have come full circle. I love to fully use my logical mind when I manage an #architectural project AND I also have my heart white open and access to my creativity when designing.
Magic & logic is how I create and how my line of #handbags came about, as a creative exercise on my way back to #wholeheartedness (thank you Bren√© Brown).
The bags have structure AND amazing colours to brighten your business-day. I created them with so much love, attention to detail AND they are so soft to touch.
Which is yur favourite?

Becoming more climate friendly is not about radically changing your entire life overnight.

It‚Äôs about slowly learning and gradually taking more and more steps which are good for both you and the planet. It‚Äôs about self love and personal development, and this is a slow process ‚ù§Ô∏è

Could you become better at investing your money in something that is good and productive for you instead of buying more things? 
Could you perhaps explore your own country or the neighbouring countries instead of flying half across the world? 
Could you use your bicycle or public transportation more instead of the car? Or could you change the car to an electric one?
Could you use Ecosia more than Google?
Could you teach your kids about nature? 
Could you buy more local? 
Could you take better care of your body and eat greener? 
Could you do with less materialism and have more freedom?
Could you learn to love yourself and life itself? Could you learn to love all life on this planet and do more good? 
Could you give more than you took?

Yesterday I was so upset that I had to direct my anger towards something creative. Why I was angry? I had a row with my husband about my yesterday's post!(which I probably remove, but only because other people on IG put my exact thoughts out there much better than I ever could). I don't won't to be quiet, I wanted to use this small platform to talk about issues that bother me, I am not here to please anyone.

Anyhow, I made yesterday those hessian scrubbies out of old coffee bag (coffee was a gift from a friend from Brazil) and I used my son's old trousers (cut into pieces of course) as a filler (organic cotton, thank you). Trousers were repaired many times around the knees, they are now too small and too worn to pass to my nephew. So I made shorts out of them (because they still fit around my son's skinny bum) and I have dish scrubbies/sponges. It's a win-winüòéüéâüèÜ.
I was inspired by one of the accounts I follow to do it myself, it looked easy the way they made it (I need to find this account, will let you know). I wanted a scrubbie badly, but refused to buy new, because of my minimalist approach, but this is something I really missed, especially for narrow neck cups and wine glasses. I couldn't clean glasses properly with a brush and I can't fit some glasses into dishwasher. Problem solved ü§ì
Scrubbies are washable and I believe they might be compostable, definitely can go to garden waste.

P. S. You can use them to scrub off inequity, patriarchy and social inequality but that is a tough task.

Plastic pollution¬†is the accumulation of¬†plastic¬†objects and particles (e.g.¬†plastic bottles,¬†bags¬†and¬†microbeads) in the Earth's¬†environment¬†that adversely affects¬†wildlife,¬†wildlife habitat, and¬†humans.[1][2]¬†Plastics that act as¬†pollutants¬†are categorized into micro-, meso-, or macro debris, based on size.[3]¬†Plastics are inexpensive and durable, and as a result levels of plastic production by humans are high.[4]¬†However, the chemical structure of most plastics renders them resistant to many natural processes of¬†degradation¬†and as a result they are slow to degrade.[5]¬†Together, these two factors have led to a high prominence of plastic¬†pollution¬†in the environment .

#FunFactFriday 

Plastic pollution¬†is the accumulation of¬†plastic¬†objects and particles (e.g.¬†plastic bottles,¬†bags¬†and¬†microbeads) in the Earth's¬†environment¬†that adversely affects¬†wildlife,¬†wildlife habitat, and¬†humans.[1][2]¬†Plastics that act as¬†pollutants¬†are categorized into micro-, meso-, or macro debris, based on size.[3]¬†Plastics are inexpensive and durable, and as a result levels of plastic production by humans are high.[4]¬†However, the chemical structure of most plastics renders them resistant to many natural processes of¬†degradation¬†and as a result they are slow to degrade.[5]¬†Together, these two factors have led to a high prominence of plastic¬†pollution¬†in the environment .

Billions of searches are made around the world per day.
Switching to a more eco-friendly search engine is an easy way for you make a difference without having to even move.
Search engines make massive amounts of money. So using an app such as Ecosia or OceanHero will help this money to go towards helping our planet.

Ecosia - A search made using ecosia helps the planet by planting trees. This helps fight climate change, remove CO2 from the air, restore landscapes, protect wildlife and provide nutrition, employment + education to people who need it. This leads to healthier, happier and more economically stable communities. Ecosia also owns and operates its own solar plant, so your searches are powered by renewable energy.

OceanHero - Searches made using OceanHero help support solving the problem of plastic pollution of the oceans. Every time you use the Ocean Hero search engine, they use 50% of profits to help stop plastic entering the oceans.

We hope that our tips will show you how easy it is to take care of the planet with your lifestyle. We hope you enjoy our page. üåçüå±

Maaltijdsalade van rode bietjes en makreelüòç‚Å†
‚Å†
Wat heb je nodig? (4 personen)‚Å†
-500 gram gekookte rode biet‚Å†
-2 gestoomde makreelfilets ‚Å†
-2 sjalotten, gesnipperd‚Å†
-1 eetlepel grove mosterd‚Å†
-1 eetlepel witte wijnazijn‚Å†
-5 eetlepels olijfolie‚Å†
-versgemalen peper en zout‚Å†
-2 zoetzure augurken, grof gehakt‚Å†
-75 gram rucola‚Å†
‚Å†
Bereidingswijze‚Å†
1. Ontvel de bieten indien nodig en schaaf ze in dunne plakjes.‚Å†
2. Verdeel het visvlees in kleine stukjes. ‚Å†
3. Klop een dressing van de sjalot, de mosterd, de azijn, de olie en peper en zout naar smaak. ‚Å†
4. Leg de plakjes biet op een grote platte schaal en verdeel de vis, de augurk en de rucola erover. Lepel de dressing erover en zet tot gebruik in de koelkast of serveer direct. ‚Å†
‚Å†

Andy Goldsworthy, Rowan Leaves Laid Around A Hole, 
1987

Much of Goldsworthy‚Äôs land art is transient and ephemeral, leading many to view it as a comment on the Earth‚Äôs fragility. But for Goldsworthy, the picture is more complicated.
‚ÄúWhen I make something, in a field, street or altering the landscape, it may vanish, but it‚Äôs part of the history of those places,‚Äù he says in another interview. ‚ÄúIn the early days, my work was about collapse and decay. Now some of the changes that occur are too beautiful to be described as simply decay. At Folkestone, I got up early one morning ahead of an incoming tide and covered a boulder in poppy petals. It was calm, and the sea slowly and gently washed away the petals, stripping the boulder and creating splashes of red in the sea. The harbor from which many troops left for war was in the background.‚Äù

24th July 2020.

The day wearing a face covering in a shop became mandatory (unless you have medical exemption. Or apparently are in Asda or Tesco because they don‚Äôt seem to care).

I wear my mask for you. 

I wear it because I could be asymptomatic and I want to help protect those who are vulnerable. 

I wear it because I don‚Äôt want to be the reason someone is ventilated.

I wear it because going to the supermarket on my own in the evening is like a spa break at the moment and I‚Äôd like to continue doing that.

I do it because my husband will divorce me if the Amazon man turns up again so it means I can physically go to the shops I need things from.

Yes, it gets hot. Yes, it feels weird. Yes, I worry Buddy will be sad not to see smiling faces when in a shop. But I think I prefer it to a ventilator. 

Please stop asking the government to spoon feed you - if you are able to wear it inside (eg you aren‚Äôt eating or drinking) in a public place, then just assume you should be wearing it. Common sense please people, let‚Äôs protect the more vulnerable among us.

I‚Äôve seen enough of hospitals in the last year, I don‚Äôt fancy seeing another high dependency bed...

Current inspo - The Handmaids Tale.

BREAK UP WITH SINGLE USE PLASTIC. 
Share this on and pledge to #breakupwithplastic
----------------------------------------------------

Sometimes our relationship with plastics can feel very complicated. On the one hand we think about all the advancements plastic has brought us in modern society. We convince ourself of all of the apparent benefits and then shrug off any uncomfortable realities that don't align with the one we have created. But this is a luxury that many people, primarily in the West, can only afford.

We ship away our plastics rather than deal with the reality of what we have created. We ship them to developing countries to poison their bodies and air. 

Single use plastic is a plague in our society. The pollution generated from the lifecycle of plastic, from extracting the raw materials to the end of its life in landfills, oceans and the incinerator, disproportionately damages the lives of black, indigenous and people of colour. 

Single use plastic doesn't just harm wildlife, it kills people. 
Reduce your consumption of single use plastic and send a clear message to Big Plastic and its allies.

Making cashew milk! ü•õü•õ
Swipe right to see the process and me squeezing the nut milk bag üòâüòâ 
There are two ways to do it...
 üë©‚Äçüç≥The easier way is add 2 tbsp cashew butter to 2 cups water & blend. Depending on your blender this will probably have a bit of fibre in it and so probably not the best for hot drinks, but perfect for baking, porridge etc. You could probably strain it through a nut milk bag to get the bits out. 
üë©‚Äçüç≥The high grade way! Soak 1 cup of cashews in water for at least 3 hours (or overnight in fridge). Drain & rinse well. Add to blender along with 4 cups of water, a date (optional) & a pinch of salt. Blend well, pour into a nut milk bag and squeeze out the milk (lol). You'll get about 1litre of milk and some "cashew pulp". You can use the pulp to make biscuits, hummus, crackers & other things! 
üë©‚ÄçüîßHave you tried making your own milk?? Let me know how it went in comments!

Know about Sustainable Housing

Has anyone else been wearing less make up? There‚Äôs nothing like having no plans to make you revise your make up routine. 
.
I‚Äôve worn make up since I was a teen... concealer, foundation, mascara, eyeliner, eye brow pencil... then eye shadow, lip liner and blusher. 
.
I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything wrong with wearing make up. It‚Äôs anyone‚Äôs choice, which they shouldn‚Äôt be shamed for. For me, I never felt good about myself without wearing it.
.
I‚Äôve had periods of acne and bad skin, which contributes to the cycle of feeling bad about yourself. And in the past when I‚Äôve had mentally low points, I couldn‚Äôt muster up the energy to take my make up off at night, which again adds to the cycle of bad skin. 
.
I‚Äôve always silently wished that I could be one of those people who didn‚Äôt feel like they had to wear a full face of make up, and didn‚Äôt care what people thought of them.
.
So, for all of these reasons it‚Äôs been nice to frequently be wearing NO make up. It‚Äôs also given me the opportunity to start liking my face, which I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôve ever done before.
.
It has also been helpful that my sweet boyfriend regularly reminds me that he loves and prefers how I look with no make up (which blows my mind!). He says it so genuinely that I believe he‚Äôs not just saying that! 
.
This isn‚Äôt me saying never again will I wear a drop of make up! I‚Äôm going out for lunch and will probably wear mascara and concealer. Instead, it‚Äôs me saying that I like how I look both with and without make up, and maybe I‚Äôll do more of the latter. 
.
I‚Äôve even had days where I‚Äôve not looked in the mirror, and I love that because it means I‚Äôm not obsessing about what I look like. 
.
I‚Äôm also looking forward to exploring #plasticfree make up options, which I haven‚Äôt done yet because I‚Äôm using up what I have, which is a lot!
.

We are all surrounded by nature. Nature changes constantly and we as humans are making more changes to it based on our lifestyle. There will be no natural resources without the balance in nature. But are we doing our part in saving Mother Nature?

Reasons why we need to save nature

1.We can reduce the water shortage by taking preventive measures. A number of countries are facing a water shortage today.
2.Saving nature can help get rid of food shortage as well.
3.We can reduce the ill effects of pollution by planting more trees.
4.Surrounded by nature helps reduce stress, which is common with people who lead a sedentary lifestyle.
5.All humans and other living being are protected by nature, and the consequences can be bad if we try and tamper it.
6.By saving nature, we can make sure that all the planet‚Äôs inhabitants have the needed supply of water and air.
7.Oxygen is produced by trees and cutting them can show an impact on human health.
So, nature is important and let us not destroy it!

One of the reasons some parents don't give cloth a go is the extra washing. However, cloth nappies only add an extra load every two to three days. One argument used against cloth is this extra washing. However, the electricity and water used to wash nappies doesn't compare to the amount of water and energy which is actually used to create and dispose of disposable nappies. Not to mention the other benefits of reducing waste and saving money. Each child will use between 4000 to 6000 disposable nappies as opposed to around 30 resuable ones with cloth üåø

In the last part of our Plastic Free July blog series, we want to talk about coffee cups.‚Å†
‚Å†
Not only do most cafes use plastic lids, the disposable cups themselves are lined with plastic polyethylene, which is tightly bonded to the paper. This lining is what enables the cups to hold liquid. It is also one of the reasons why the cups are difficult to recycle, combined with the fact that they are contaminated with drink.‚Å†
‚Å†
To find out more about what reusable options are available instead of #singleuse cups, read part 3 of our #PlasticFreeJuly blog series on ecobella.co.uk.‚Å†

Las tres erres (3R) es una regla para cuidar el medio ambiente, espec√≠ficamente para reducir el volumen de residuos o basura generada. En pocas palabras, las 3R ayudan a tirar menos basura, a ahorrar y a ser un consumidor m√°s responsable. Y lo mejor de todo es que es muy f√°cil de seguir: reducir, reutilizar y reciclar.

Reducir: Debemos tratar de reducir o simplificar el consumo de los productos directos, o sea, todos aquellos que se compran y se consumen, ya que tienen una relaci√≥n directa con los desperdicios. Por ejemplo, en vez de comprar 6 latas peque√±as de una bebida, compra dos botellas grandes, tendr√°s el mismo producto pero habr√°s generado menos basura.

Reutilizar: Nos estamos refiriendo a poder volver a utilizar las cosas. A darles la mayor utilidad posible antes de que llegue la hora de deshacernos de ellas. Y as√≠, disminuir el volumen de basura. Esta tarea suele ser la que menos atenci√≥n recibe y es una de las m√°s importantes. Por ejemplo, cuando vayas a hacer la compra lleva un carro o bolsas reutilizables.

Reciclar: La √∫ltima de las tareas es la de reciclar, que consiste en someter materiales usados o desperdicios a un proceso de transformaci√≥n o aprovechamiento para que puedan ser nuevamente utilizados

Anoche dejamos reposando la masa para terminar esta ma√±ana nuestro rico, sencillo, natural y saludable pan sin gluten de trigo sarraceno con s√©samo y semillas de girasol y calabaza. ¬°Te dejo los pasos seguidos en su f√°cil elaboraci√≥n, por si te animas a hacerlo!:
1.- En un bol de cristal, loza o similar (no de pl√°stico) mezclar bien los ingredientes secos (en este caso, 250 gr. de harina de trigo sarraceno -utilizamos la sin gluten de @rincondelsegura, que es estupenda-, 25 gr. de psyllium en polvo -que le aporta esponjosidad, aparte de fibra-, una cucharada de postre rasa de levadura de pan en polvo y otra de sal, un buen pu√±ado de pipas de girasol y otro de calabaza y una cucharada sopera de gomasio -s√©samo molido con sal-).
2.- Verter sobre la mezcla 400 ml. de agua tibia (¬°no caliente, que nos cargamos la levadura! Nosotros la hemos puesto 30" con el¬† microondas a potencia m√°xima -900W en este caso-) y amasar a mano hasta que est√© todo bien mezclado (debe quedar una masa densa, pero no dura).
3.- Colocar la mezcla en un molde de silicona (si fuera de otro material habr√≠a que untarlo con AOVE para que no se pegara, pero en este caso no har√≠a falta), espolvorearla con otro poquito de gomasio y taparla con un trapo de algod√≥n h√∫medo.
4.- Dejar reposar toda la noche en un lugar c√°lido y fuera de corrientes para que fermente y crezca.
5.- Al d√≠a siguiente, precalentar el horno a 225¬∞C (con la funci√≥n turbo o de aire), colocar un cuenco de agua dentro, meter el molde con la masa y hornearla 10'.
6.- Bajar la temperatura a 200¬∞C y hornear 1h m√°s.
7.- Sacarlo del horno, desmoldarlo, dejarlo enfriar en una rejilla ¬°y a disfrutarlo!!!

Cuando se enfr√≠a lo cortamos en rebanadas, lo congelamos y por las ma√±anas lo tostamos directamente, sin descongelarlo antes.

CLIMATARIAN? Apakah sama dengan Vegetarian?

Pada umumnya seorang #climatarian, menghindari memakan daging dan bahan pangan yang memiliki jejak karbon yang tinggi.

Seorang climatarian berbeda dengan seorang vegetarian, karena seorang climatarian bisa menolak buah atau sayuran impor yang lebih tinggi jejak karbonnya dibandingkan buah dan sayuran lokal. 

Seorang climatarian bukan berarti menjadi seorang yang anti makan daging, tetapi lebih mawas dengan pilihan makanan yang mengandung jejak karbon tinggi. Seorang climatarian tahu bedanya jejak karbon yang dihasilkan peternakan ayam vs peternakan sapi, dan mengetahui jika daging sapi menghasilkan jejak karbon yang lebih besar daripada emisi bahan bakar fosil.

Apakah kamu seorang #climatarian atau kenal seorang #climatarian? Tag orangnya yuk!

It‚Äôs the 19th century in Great Britain. Fear of witchcraft and enchantment is at large. To protect yourself, you snap a few twigs off the rowan tree. Perhaps the tree with its vicious red berries may help let you live another day.

Rowan (Sorbus aucuparia) is a native European tree, with a fascinating mystical history. Rowans are easily identifiable by its distinctive pinnate, which comprises of 5-8 individual leaflets. Rowans also produce scarlet berries that can be cultivated into delicious jam. It‚Äôs tough wood has also been used for woodworking.

Often found at high altitudes, rowan is also known by its other name, the mountain ash. You can find this tree on a hike up the highlands of Scotland or on a stroll down a high street.

If the translation of rowan‚Äôs old Celtic name ‚Äúfid na ndruad‚Äù (=wizards‚Äô tree) does not allude to its historical mythical association, then I don‚Äôt know what does. Because the colour red was believed to ward off evil spirits, rowans were widely planted outside houses to protect people from witches. In Scotland, it is an act of taboo to cut down a rowan tree! 

Photo: Close up of rowan pinnets with unripened berries.

This gives me the perfect opportunity to show off my new "recycling hub", as it's been lovingly named here.
Not only is it perfect for sorting all my different recycling streams (our local council is rubbish at recycling and it's very limited in what plastics it will take) but it was made using the old decking we took up in the garden (by my husband,  not me, I did not inherit any woodworking genes from dad)! It isn't quite finished but is already doing an awesome job for all my boxes. And yes I do have a box for "good jars" as that's who I am now üòÇ
He also whipped up a bike ramp/jump for the kids!
He might not be able to put on a load of washing but he has his uses üòÅ

A new COVID-19 outbreak has occurred in the administrative center of the Xinjiang Uighur Autonomous Region. A "wartime state‚Äù has officially been declared in the city of Urumqi. No new cases had been detected in Xinjiang over the last five months. The situation is complicated as the territory of the Autonomous region contains the infamous "re-education camps" (Xinjiang re-education camps), where Chinese citizens who profess Islam (mainly ethnic Uighurs) are detained by force. International human rights organizations classify these institutions as Chinese counterparts of Nazi concentration camps. For example, a video from Xinjiang, which shows hundreds of prisoners with their hands tied behind their backs and black bandages covering their eyes, caused a significant negative response. Should the virus gets into these camps, it is unlikely that they will be able to avoid a mass spread of the infection.
